I would be interested in knowing how the pricing system on Steam works.

if they are selling the game for 15$ instead of 23$, who gets 8$ less? Valve or Squad?

If it works like the promotions I know*, Squad is paying 8$ to Steam for each unit sold during the promotion. So basically it is Squad not Steam that is making the promotion.

* These promotions I know are the ones of a food producer I work for. They pay the supermarket the difference in prices. Bear in mind the product is still profitable for the producer after the promotion, either in terms of money or of "image" to the public

Both Steam and Squad should benefit from this.
